description: [Status: stable] [Name: useless-object-inheritance] [Message: Class {name} inherits from object] What it does Checks for classes that inherit from object. Why is this bad? Since Python 3, all classes inherit from object by default, so object can be omitted from the list of base classes. Example class Foo(object): ... Use instead: class Foo: ... Fix safety This fix is unsafe if it would cause comments to be deleted.
